div1.p: Fitzgerald discusses activities on behalf of Emilie Lawrence Reed and the pension bill.

div1.head: Letter from Charles E. Fitzgerald to William A. Tansey, April 25, 1929
div1.p:
I received your most
welcome letter some time ago. And sure
was pleased to hear from. You, and yours,
and to note you are all progressing
nicely. I trust by the time this reaches
you that Lottie has fully recovered and
again finding her in her usual
normal condition which I think can
be brought about by reason of
her great M. D. Husband.

All out here at present very well
including my self. I should answered
your letter sooner but I was waiting
to get hold of the Men I wanted
to write Harold Knutson Congressman
from Sixth District Minnesota. Not
from my District and Succeeded in
getting some of them which they promi-
sed Me. to write Congressman Knutson
in behalf of Mrs Walter Reed (Emilie L.
Reed) as She Signs herself. I also took
#2
the matter up with our State
legislative Board which they complied
with my request and wrote him a copy
of their instrument I am enclosing
to you. I was very anxious to do something
for Mrs Reed, by reason of Your Appeal
to Me. I took the Matter up with Dr
Voyer but dont know what he done
about it. as I dont See him very often
I trust that She may get the increase
in her pension at least Some more
than She is Now recieving.

We had a nice visit from Jim Griffin
lost fall and enjoyed him very much he
was here during the Genl Election in
Nov. at My House getting the Election
returns over the Radio Election night.
I thought Jim would pass away as the returns
were coming in adverse to Al Smith in
the State of New York. Now getting back to
the question of you coming out here to pay
us a visit which you have attention to the
fact. That you do not want to defer this
visit to long if you want to find us
all here. I trust that you may find
time to write me occasionally. So I
may know who you are. So I will
close for this time. Kindly remember
me to all the Tansey Family. And with
kindest regards and best wishes from
Dell and myself. I am as ever your cousin

closer.signed:
Chos. E. Fitzgerald.
730 Laurel ave
St Paul,
Min.
